title: Confusing diagnostic when `impl IntoFuture` is passed to a function expecting `impl Future`

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

body:
### Code

```Rust
use core::future::{IntoFuture, Future};
fn expect_future(_: impl Future) {}
fn test(into: impl IntoFuture) {
    expect_future(into)
}
```

([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=7a9528ffea58937dd45911b6c7f45dd4))

### Current output

```text
error[E0277]: `impl IntoFuture` is not a future
 --> src/lib.rs:4:19
  |
4 |     expect_future(into)
  |     ------------- ^^^^ `impl IntoFuture` is not a future
  |     |
  |     required by a bound introduced by this call
  |
  = note: impl IntoFuture must be a future or must implement `IntoFuture` to be awaited
note: required by a bound in `expect_future`
 --> src/lib.rs:2:26
  |
2 | fn expect_future(_: impl Future) {}
  |                          ^^^^^^ required by this bound in `expect_future`
help: consider further restricting this bound
  |
3 | fn test(into: impl IntoFuture + std::future::Future) {
  |                               +++++++++++++++++++++
```


### Desired output

```text
error[E0277]: `impl IntoFuture` is not a future
 --> src/lib.rs:4:19
  |
4 |     expect_future(into)
  |     ------------- ^^^^ `impl IntoFuture` is not a future
  |     |
  |     required by a bound introduced by this call
  |
note: required by a bound in `expect_future`
 --> src/lib.rs:2:26
  |
2 | fn expect_future(_: impl Future) {}
  |                          ^^^^^^ required by this bound in `expect_future`
help: consider calling `.into_future()`
  |
4 |     expect_future(into.into_future()) {
  |                       ++++++++++++++
```


### Rationale and extra context

The note provided by the compiler is very confusing:
```text
  = note: impl IntoFuture must be a future or must implement `IntoFuture` to be awaited
```
1. `impl IntoFuture` implements `IntoFuture`, so it looks like the error shouldn't happen
2. There is no `.await` in the code

Additionally the correct solution here (more likely than not) is to call `IntoFuture::into_future`, and not to add a bound, `impl IntoFuture + Future` is quite weird (all `Future`s are already `IntoFuture`...)
